title: Bacterial Morphology & Staining
body:
Bacterial Shapes and Stains

Bacteria can be cocci, bacilli, or spirilla. Gram staining differentiates Gram-positive from Gram-negative organisms.

title: Culture Media and Growth
body:
Culture Techniques

Common media include nutrient agar, MacConkey, and blood agar. Colony morphology and hemolysis patterns help in identification.

title: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing
body:
Antibiotic Testing

Determines bacterial susceptibility to antibiotics. Methods include disk diffusion (Kirby-Bauer) and MIC determination.
